intro: Phoradendron ottonis, commonly known as the mistletoe of the Yucatán, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Its growth is facilitated by a specialized root system that attaches to the host tree and extracts water and nutrients. Phoradendron ottonis plays a significant ecological role in its native habitats, contributing to biodiversity and supporting a range of animal species.
